doc.title: non-normative

value.content: Software specifications often contains information marked as non-normative or informative, which means that those are provided there to help the readers to understand the specification better or to show an example or a best practice and not need to be followed as a rule. Sections that contain the official part of the specification that must be followed are often marked as normative.

value.title: See also
value.content: • Description of normative and informative content in WHATWG wiki
